flash.name: Flash Message
flash.description: Flash notification component for user feedback with message and dismiss button. Auto-configured by type (success, error, warning, info). Displays as fixed overlay at top-center of viewport, stacking multiple messages vertically.

overview.title: Flash Message Usage Patterns
overview.description: Flash messages in this system support two distinct usage patterns

methods.title: Pattern 1: Static Server-Side Rendering (CakePHP Flash)
methods.description: The traditional approach where flash messages are set in the controller and rendered on page load.
methods.note: Use When: Showing feedback after form submissions, redirects, or page reloads.

methods.title: Pattern 2: Dynamic Client-Side Rendering (JavaScript)
methods.description: Dynamic injection of flash messages via JavaScript without page reload.
methods.note: Use When: Showing feedback for AJAX operations, real-time updates, or client-side validations without page reload.

controller_usage.title: Usage in Controllers

escape.description: Whether to HTML-escape the message content

examples.title: Toast Positioning (Fixed Overlay)

params.message: Flash messages appear as fixed overlays at the top of the screen, above all content including the header (z-index: 100). They do not push content down.

examples.note: Positioned via global container in layout: fixed top-4 left-1/2 -translate-x-1/2 z-[100]

mock_comment_data.content: This is a detailed comment about the use case description. It provides valuable feedback and suggestions for improvement.
Overall, the documentation looks comprehensive. Good work on addressing all the quality criteria.

I have several observations:

1. The technical requirements need more detail
2. Consider adding edge case scenarios
3. The testing approach seems thorough

Please review these points before the next iteration.

]) ?>

methods.title: Programmatically from JavaScript
With AJAX Content Loading
methods.code:
<button data-modal-trigger="my-modal" data-modal-url="/api/content">Load & Open</button>

loadModalContent('my-modal', '/api/content');

methods.title: Using $dispatch (Recommended for AJAX content)
methods.note: Automatically gets correct modal ID from Alpine.js context

important_notes: Modal IDs and trigger names are case-sensitive. Ensure the modal 'id' exactly matches the trigger's 'data-modal-trigger' value.
